intro: Pilocarpus trifoliolatus, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Pilocarpus trifoliolatus is often grown for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and historical use in traditional medicine.
